content.description: A short problem with a few tension moves to start and a quality satisfying topout. Consists of all decently sharp crimps and a positive topout ledge.
content.location: Start left hand on the crimp separated from the main cluster of holds and right over on the clear crimp toward the left side of the main cluster. Use delicate footwork to trek in and traverse slightly out right before making a bigger move to the top ledge and a nice rollover topout. (Foot beta: toe hook)

content.description: A short problem working through a nice juggy rounded hold perching up into a crescent moon hollow crimp.
content.location: Located on the lower right cave section.  Problem starts on the left arete with two decent crimps.  Work up into a bucket rounded hold and perch up making a right hand reach up to a crescent moon crimp.  Stand up into the topout.

content.description: A fun but sharp problem on the lower right cave face.  Work your way through some classic RI sharp crimps and gritty slopers.  It hurts, but all in all still a very worthwhile problem.
content.location: Located on the lower right cave face.  Problem is on the left side of that cave in the mini half dome like feature.  Start right hand about halfway up the crimp rail and left all the way on the left small crimp. Work some delicate foot beta to trek your left hand in and work along the lower crimp line.  Move your right hand into the beginning of the dome and traverse along the edge of that into the topout at the apex straight above the original starting holds.

content.description: A problem starting partially in a cave and slapping up some decent gritty slopers into a tricky topout.
content.location: Located on the back side/around the large face that Tension Blade is on. Starts right on a large ledge under the overhang, left on the lower sloper on the arete with legs horizontal under the rock (be sure not to dab the rock below you). Work your way up each side of the face to the top ledge and get your feet and body high enough to reach up and over a tricky topout.

content.description: A set of cave/slightly overhung face boulders deep into the woods of Beach Pond.  Offers a select few fun problems with sharp holds, however, the good majority of the cave and large faces are either choss or blank.
